content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm always looking to get the best possible price for my properties. So, let's get down to business. What do you think the apartment is worth? What kind of rent are you willing to pay?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I am willing to pay 500 euros per month. This is a fair price for an unfurnished one-bedroom apartment in the city center.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand that you have done your research and have a clear idea of the market rate for apartments in the city center. However, I must inform you that the market rate for a newly built, unfurnished one-bedroom apartment like this one is actually higher than 500 euros per month.

In fact, similar apartments in the area are renting for around 700-800 euros per month. I understand that this may be a bit higher than your budget, but I assure you that it is a fair price considering the quality and location of the apartment.

I am willing to negotiate and meet you in the middle, however. How about we say 600 euros per month? This is a fair compromise that takes into account both your budget and the market rate for the apartment. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I don't think 600 euros is a good idea. 550 euros would be more reasonable. This is closer to my budget and still a fair price for the apartment.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm afraid that 550 euros is a bit too low for the apartment. As I mentioned earlier, the market rate for similar apartments in the area is around 700-800 euros per month.

I'm willing to make a slight compromise, but I can't go any lower than 575 euros per month. This is still a fair price for the apartment, and it's closer to the market rate than 550 euros. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 575 euros per month. This is a fair price for both parties and I am happy with the result of the negotiation.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! At 575 euros per month, this apartment is a great deal for you, and it's still a fair price for me as the landlord. I'm confident that you'll be happy with your new home.

Just one more thing before we finalize the lease: I need to mention that there is a one-time cleaning fee of 100 euros, which will be due when you move in. This is a standard fee for all tenants, and it helps ensure that the apartment is left in good condition for the next renter.

So, with the monthly rent of 575 euros and the one-time cleaning fee of 100 euros, your total move-in cost will be 675 euros.

Does that sound good to you?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 575 euros per month. However, I don't want to continue the negotiation, because we already agreed on the rental price and I don't want to discuss additional costs like the cleaning fee.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Understood, no problem. I apologize for bringing up the cleaning fee again. I'm glad we could come to an agreement on the rental price.

So, just to confirm, you agree to rent the apartment for 575 euros per month, and you're ready to sign the lease agreement. Is that correct?

If so, I'll prepare the lease agreement and we can sign it soon.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 575 euros per month!
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! At 575 euros per month, this apartment is a great deal for you, and it's still a fair price for me as the landlord. I'm confident that you'll be happy with your new home.

Now, before we sign the lease agreement, I just need to mention a few additional details. First, the lease will be for a minimum of 6 months, and then it will automatically renew unless one of us gives notice. Second, you'll need to provide a security deposit of 1000 euros, which will be returned to you when you move out, assuming there's no damage to the apartment. Finally, utility costs such as electricity, water, and gas will be split between us, with you paying for your own usage.

Do you have any questions about these terms? If not, I'll prepare the lease agreement and we can sign it soon.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
